country.name: Belgium
country.overview: Belgium, a country in Western Europe, is known for medieval towns, Renaissance architecture and as headquarters of the European Union and NATO. The country has distinctive regions including Dutch-speaking Flanders to the north, French-speaking Wallonia to the south and a German-speaking community to the east. The bilingual capital, Brussels, has ornate guildhalls at Grand-Place and elegant art-nouveau buildings.

translations.name: ປະເທດແບນຊິກ
ဘယ်လ်ဂျီယမ်နိုင်ငံ
ประเทศเบลเยียม

geography.location_description: Western Europe, bordering the North Sea, between France and the Netherlands
geography.climate: temperate; mild winters, cool summers; rainy, humid, cloudy
geography.terrain: flat coastal plains in northwest, central rolling hills, rugged mountains of Ardennes Forest in southeast
geography.hazards: flooding is a threat along rivers and in areas of reclaimed coastal land, protected from the sea by concrete dikes
geography.notes: crossroads of Western Europe; most West European capitals are within 1,000 km of Brussels, the seat of both the European Union and NATO
